### R        
  
#### Installing R from Source    
  
The following guide is derived from ![a Posit guide to installing R from source](https://docs.posit.co/resources/install-r-source.html) and is tailored to Debian/Ubuntu distributions of Linux: 

- Add dependencies (build-essential, cmake, BLAS, Fortran, LApack, bzip2, header libraries):  

- Prepare additional dependencies:  

```{bash prep_R_source, eval=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, echo=FALSE, layout="l-body-outset", fig.width=6}

sudo sed -i.bak "/^#.*deb-src.*universe$/s/^# //g" /etc/apt/sources.list
sudo apt update
sudo apt build-dep r-base

```

- Set target R version:  

```{bash set_R_version, eval=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, echo=FALSE, layout="l-body-outset", fig.width=6}

export R_VERSION=4.4.1

```

- Download R target: 

```{bash download_R_version, eval=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, echo=FALSE, layout="l-body-outset", fig.width=6}

curl -O https://cran.rstudio.com/src/base/R-4/R-${R_VERSION}.tar.gz
tar -xzvf R-${R_VERSION}.tar.gz
cd R-${R_VERSION}

```

- Build R: 

```{bash build_R_version, eval=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, echo=FALSE, layout="l-body-outset", fig.width=6}

./configure \
  --prefix=/opt/R/${R_VERSION} \
  --enable-R-shlib \
  --enable-memory-profiling \
  --with-blas \
  --with-lapack

make
sudo make install

```

- Set R symlinks: 

```{bash set_R_version, eval=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, echo=FALSE, layout="l-body-outset", fig.width=6}

/opt/R/${R_VERSION}/bin/R --version

sudo ln -s -f /opt/R/${R_VERSION}/bin/R /usr/local/bin/R
sudo ln -s -f /opt/R/${R_VERSION}/bin/Rscript /usr/local/bin/Rscript


```
